**Lawmaking**: Senators have the power to introduce, and vote on bills that become laws in the United States.
They can also co-sponsor legislation introduced by other senators.
They work with their colleagues in the Senate and House of Representatives to draft, debate, and pass legislation.
They work with representatives from the House of Representatives to pass legislation.
